subject: Physical Fitness
title: Age and Flexibility
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Age and Flexibility.

hook.text: Children fold like origami. By middle age, touching your toes can feel like an achievement.

buildup.text: Collagen in tendons and ligaments stiffens with age. Water content in discs and cartilage decreases.

discovery.text: Most flexibility loss comes from inactivity, not aging. Muscles shorten when they're rarely taken through full range.

twist.text: Studies show people in their 70s can regain significant range with consistent stretching programs.

climax.text: The decline is real but largely preventable. Moving through full range regularly preserves what you have.

punchline.text: Age stiffens you only if you let it. Movement is the antidote.
